result.execSummary:
The defendant Niesha M Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
PER ORDER OF 01-20-2015:  SENTENCE IS STAYED PENDING APPEAL.
Court costs ($258) and DNA surcharge ($200) are to be paid in full at $25 per month commencing 03-01-2015 and the 1st of each month until paid or serve 9 days jail as penalty for non payment.

PER ORDER OF 01-20-2015:  SENTENCE IS STAYED PENDING APPEAL.
Huber with standard release conditions.
Defendant to report to Huber by 06:00 p.m. on 01-23-2015.
Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County.
AMENDED 10-07-2015:  COURT LIFTS THE STAY OF SENTENCE.  Defendant is to report to the Huber Facility on 10-16-2015 no later than 06:00 p.m.
(can be served through Milwaukee County).  If the defendant fails to appear/report to Huber Facility on 10-16-2015, the Court will issue a warrant for the defendan'ts arrest and the sentence will be served straight time.
